name: Verify curve speed presets apply correctly and affect video playback smoothly.
Verify that the Duplicate option creates a copy of the selected preset successfully.
Save the project in Draft, reopen it, and confirm that the overlay settings are retained.
Verify applying playback speeds (2x, 5x, 10x, 20x) updates the preview accordingly.
Verify that there should be no sort option in the bottom menu when user only select one media
Verify the right trim handler adjusts the video endpoint correctly.
Verify the user can successfully apply a keyframe at a video.
Verify that on clicking Edit, the background of the image can be changed successfully.
Apply an overlay on a video and ensure it displays properly.
Verify that clicking the Remove Preset button removes the applied preset from the media.
After adding media, verify the toast message appears as expected.
Verify that the user can replace the existing audio with a new one.
Verify that on clicking Edit, adding two media items allows successful deletion of selected media.
Verify that the app maintains the sorted order after closing and reopening the project.
Verify the left trim handler adjusts the video start point correctly.
Select a gallery background and check it applies correctly to the media.
Verify that the user can press and hold a media item and successfully drag it to a new position in the same list.
Check that the 4:3 canvas applies correctly and media looks fine.
Open the Chroma tool and verify the “i” icon (guide/helper) opens correctly.
Verify Export and the changes are reflected in the exported output.
Verify the video cannot be split if the remaining duration is less than 2 seconds.
Verify that applying a preset and saving it to a draft retains the preset when reopening the draft
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Vertical Flip reflects correctly in the media preview.
Verify that the user can record custom audio and apply it to the video.
Verify export is working fine
Trim the overlay video using trim handles and verify correct behavior in the preview.
TC-FZ-001: Open editor and select media
Verify the reset speed button restores default playback speed.
Verify that the user can trim the audio clip to adjust its duration.
Verify that the Edit option allows modifying a preset and saving changes correctly.
Select the sticker seek bar, apply animations [Intro, Outro, Loop], and verify the changes in the preview.
Apply an overlay on an image and verify that it appears correctly in the Preview.
Verify that the applied text settings (font, color, style) are saved and restored correctly when opened from Drafts.
Zoom in/zoom out the sticker in the preview and verify the behavior.
Verify that the text and its applied styles are retained correctly in the exported output.
Verify that the user can expand or reduce the seek bar to adjust audio duration on the video timeline.
Verify the export flow when a sticker and animation are applied to media.
Verify that multiple media items can be reordered one after another without breaking the sequence
Select the sticker seek bar, click Edit, and verify the Opacity and Scale adjustments work correctly.
Verify multiple splits can be performed smoothly on videos longer than 1 hour.
Verify that the media playback or preview follows the new inline sorting order.
Apply animation to the sticker and verify the Remove button for animation works correctly.
Verify that the user can drag and drop items in the sorting screen to rearrange their order.
Verify that on clicking Edit, decreasing the media duration updates it to the minimum limit and reflects accurately on the timeline.
Verify the sticker duplicate functionality works as expected.
Drag the sticker seek bar across all media and verify the sticker is applied to all media.
Verify the draft flow when a sticker and animation are applied to media.
Check that the 16:9 canvas changes to a wide screen and shows media correctly.
Verify that font styles can be applied correctly to the text.
Verify that the user can successfully add audio to a video from any available source.
Apply sticker animation and verify the sticker duration is correct.
TC-FZ-002: Add Effect on Single  Media , remove effect then save in Draft
Undo / Redo all changes and  verify the that changes reflect in preview.
Verify keyframes persist after saving a project as a draft and reopening it.
Save the Project in draft , Reopen project and verify changes.
TC-FZ-003: Open Draft project and Extend effect Sub bar:
Verify Export media with tune effects.
Verify that the Delete option removes the selected preset successfully.
Verify that on clicking Edit, a single media item is not deleted and the correct toast message is displayed.
Check that the overlay sub-bar can be extended and applied to other media clips.
Verify that tapping on the “Sorting” option navigates the user to the dedicated sorting screen successfully.
Apply Chroma effect on a video and verify it applies properly.
Export Media
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Rotate 270° reflects accurately in the media preview.
Verify the video split feature works properly at the selected timestamp.
Verify that the Intensity bar for a preset works correctly by adjusting the strength of the preset.
Verify that on clicking Edit, the background of the image can be changed and scaled properly using the slider.
Verify that bold and italic styles can be applied to the text.
Verify the delete video option removes the selected video successfully.
Verify that the overlay can be deleted and is removed from the preview and timeline.
Verify the reverse function plays the video backward smoothly without issues.
Verify that the user can remove background noise using the denoise feature.
Export the media and verify that the chroma effect is correctly visible in the final output.
Check that the 1:1 canvas applies correctly and media fits properly.
Verify that stroke can be applied to the text and displays correctly.
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Rotate 360° reflects accurately in the media preview.
Verify that on clicking Edit, increasing the media duration updates it to the maximum limit and reflects accurately on the timeline.
Apply sticker on a single image and verify it appears correctly in the preview
Ensure the user can delete a keyframe correctly using the keyframe icon.
Apply the chroma effect and save the project in Draft, then reopen it to verify the effect is retained.
Verify that on clicking Edit, the Duplicate Media option works correctly.
Apply Tune filters on Image and verify changes in Preview
Pick a custom color using the picker tool and confirm it works as expected.
Click the None button and check that it goes back to the default canvas.
Apply Chroma effect on an image and verify it applies correctly.
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Full Media displays the media properly in full frame.
Check that the 3:4 canvas applies properly and media stays in place.
Verify that fade-in and fade-out effects can be applied to the audio.
Verify that a single media file can successfully have a preset applied.
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Rotate 90° reflects accurately in the media preview.
Verify that the Remove Chroma Effect button works as expected.
Verify that the user can extract and apply audio from a video file.
Apply Horizontal Flip and Rotate on a media item, close the project, reopen it from Drafts, and verify that the changes persist in the preview.
Verify setting the volume to 0 mutes the video audio completely.
Select any canvas size, save it to Drafts, and check that the same size shows when opened again.
Verify that the Add button allows creating and saving a new preset successfully.
Apply Horizontal Flip and Rotate on a media item, export it, and verify that the changes are reflected in the exported output.
Verify that on clicking Edit, the None button works properly and removes any applied background.
Open editor and select media and apply Maximum Effect on Media
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Horizontal Flip reflects correctly in the media preview.
Verify that the user can increase or decrease the volume up to 200%.
Verify the maximum text length allowed on media and ensure it doesn’t overflow or cut off.
Verify lowering the volume decreases audio level during playback.
Verify that the user can mute or unmute a audio track on the video.
Save the project as a Draft, reopen it, and confirm that the overlay opacity remains consistent.
Verify that changes made in the separate sorting screen are correctly applied to the timeline after saving/closing.
Verify that the Reset button works correctly and reverts all text changes.
Verify the functionality of the opacity feature and ensure the changes reflect correctly
Verify that the label (or tag) appears properly on the text.
Verify Remove tune effect button is working as expected.
Verify adding two videos and deleting one does not remove the other.
Verify that the text is visible on the selected image or video.
Verify multiple keyframes can be applied and playback transitions occur smoothly between them.
Check that the 9:16 canvas changes to a tall screen (for reels/stories) and works fine.
Apply sticker on multiple images and verify it displays correctly in the preview
Verify that on clicking Edit, the background can be changed using media selected from the gallery.
Verify increasing the volume amplifies audio without distortion.
Verify that the user can delete an applied audio track from the video.
Check that the 4:5 canvas applies and media looks fine without cutting.
Export the media and verify that the overlay is correctly applied in the exported output.
Verify keyframes are successfully rendered in the exported video.
Verify that multiple images can have presets applied simultaneously and are reflected correctly.
Verify the Export
Verify that text color changes are applied properly.
Verify the export with preset effect and validate applied successfully
Verify the sticker delete functionality works as expected.
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Fit Media adjusts the media properly within the frame.
TC-FZ-004: Add a video then add effect. Extend the effect to the video:
Verify that the overlay can be resized and the changes are accurately reflected in the preview.
Verify Undo Redo functionlity respective to Sorting
Verify that on clicking Edit, applying Rotate 180° reflects accurately in the media preview.
Verify that after rearranging media items, the new order is correctly saved and reflected in the timeline.
